title: Basic Container
reference-overview: Basic Containers are used throughout the site and applications as a starting point for all boxes. Normally they contain base information along with customizable options.
reference-usage: Containers in general are used to highlight specific areas of content. The Basic Container features 3 components - header, body and footer. These components can be used in any combination - all are not required. Options for this container are rounded corners and drop shadows. A sample of a basic container is the Inline Search Container.
reference-details:
Components

  • The Basic Container is comprised of the following components:
    • Border
    • Header (optional)
    • Horizontal Line (optional)
    • Content
    • Background Color
    • Rounded Corner (optional)
    • Drop Shadow (optional)
  • The border color (#6b90b8) should always be a solid, 1 pixel gray line.
  • The headers for Basic Containers can be designated as either h1, h2, or h3.
  • The Horizontal Line directly under the Basic Container's header is (#CCCCCC).
  • The Background color is #EEEEEE.

Sizing and Layout

  • The content margins inside all Mercer Basic Containers will have 15 pixels of padding all around.
  • The padding inside a Basic Container from the line under the header to the beginning of the actual content is also 15 pixels.
  • Basic Container height and width are variable based on inside content height and width.

Grids

  • Basic Containers work within the Mercer Evolution Grid System.
  • Basic Containers can contain grids inside of them to display and section off data within the container.
reference-mobile:
• In the mobile version of this container the width will shrink to span the width of the parent container.
  • Font size increases for mobile.
